This is a typical misunderstanding of [math]E = mc^2[/math] The E here is the rest energy of an object. The full equation would be [math]E = \sqrt{ (pc)^2 + (mc^2)^2}[/math] This is the energy of an object of momentum [math]p[/math] and mass [math]m[/math]. A massive object with zero momentum has a rest energy of [math]E = mc^2[/math] A photon, however, has zero mass. The equation becomes [math]E = c p[/math] The energy of a photon is proportional to its momentum.
